chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Supplemental Motion In Limine - received

Defense counsel and the State advise the Court they are prepared for trial.
Motions in limine to be ruled on the day of trial.
Case remains scheduled for jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Elias Alvarez-Lopez not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for bail hearing and jury trial.
Court orders case adjourned for bail hearing, final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 12 pages) commencing 06-07-2022 by KATHLEEN S. WORDEN.

Defendant Elias Alvarez-Lopez in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn, appear by video.  Defendant Elias Alvarez-Lopez in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn as interpreter: Kelley D Salas. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. McDaris. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elias Alvarez-Lopez not in court, in custody. Attorney Colin McGinn in court, appear by video. Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney McGinn appointed pending a conflict check.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with NAZ; Yesica A.A.; Imelda Z.F.; Jose L.F-R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Elias Alvarez-Lopez in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Elias Alvarez-Lopez in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elias Alvarez-Lopez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea 

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
